q_geo_001.question: What is the capital of France?
q_geo_001.hint: This city is famous for the Eiffel Tower.
q_geo_001.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since the late 10th century.

q_geo_002.question: Which is the largest ocean on Earth?
q_geo_002.explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers approximately 63 million square miles.

q_geo_003.question: Which country has the longest coastline in the world?
q_geo_003.hint: This country shares the world's longest land border with the USA.
q_geo_003.explanation: Canada has over 202,080 km of coastline.

q_geo_004.question: What is the capital of Australia?
q_geo_004.hint: It was purpose-built as the capital and is not the largest city.
q_geo_004.explanation: Canberra was selected as the capital in 1908 as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

q_geo_005.question: Which river flows through the most countries?
q_geo_005.hint: This river flows through 10 European countries including Germany and Austria.
q_geo_005.explanation: The Danube flows through 10 countries in Europe.

q_geo_100.question: What is the highest mountain in the world?
q_geo_100.hint: Located in the Himalayas on the border of Nepal and Tibet.
q_geo_100.explanation: Mount Everest stands at 8,849 meters (29,032 feet) above sea level.

q_geo_006.question: Which desert is the largest hot desert in the world?
q_geo_006.hint: This African desert is almost as large as the entire United States.
q_geo_006.explanation: The Sahara Desert covers approximately 9.2 million square kilometers across North Africa.

q_geo_007.question: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
q_geo_007.hint: This country is located entirely within the city of Rome.
q_geo_007.explanation: Vatican City covers only 0.44 square kilometers and is the headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church.

q_geo_008.question: Which strait separates Europe from Asia?
q_geo_008.hint: This narrow waterway runs through the city of Istanbul.
q_geo_008.explanation: The Bosphorus strait divides Istanbul and separates European Turkey from Asian Turkey.

q_geo_009.question: What is the longest river in South America?
q_geo_009.hint: This river carries more water than any other river and flows through the world's largest rainforest.
q_geo_009.explanation: The Amazon River stretches approximately 6,400 km and has the largest discharge of any river.

q_geo_010.question: Which country has the most time zones?
q_geo_010.hint: Its overseas territories span across the globe from the Caribbean to the Pacific.
q_geo_010.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories, more than any other country including Russia's 11.

q_geo_011.question: What is the driest continent on Earth?
q_geo_011.hint: Despite being covered in ice, this continent receives very little precipitation.
q_geo_011.explanation: Antarctica is technically a desert, receiving less than 200 mm of precipitation per year on average.

q_geo_012.question: Which European country is shaped like a boot?
q_geo_012.hint: This country is a peninsula extending into the Mediterranean Sea.
q_geo_012.explanation: Italy's distinctive boot shape is one of the most recognizable country outlines in the world.

q_geo_013.question: What is the longest mountain range in the world?
q_geo_013.hint: This mountain range stretches along the western coast of South America.
q_geo_013.explanation: The Andes stretch over 7,000 km through seven South American countries, making it the longest continental mountain range.

q_geo_014.question: Which country has the most pyramids in the world?
q_geo_014.hint: This African country has over 200 pyramids, more than its famous northern neighbor.
q_geo_014.explanation: Sudan has approximately 255 pyramids, built by the ancient Nubian kingdoms of Kush, compared to Egypt's roughly 138.

q_geo_015.question: What is the largest lake by surface area in the world?
q_geo_015.hint: It is technically classified as a lake despite its name.
q_geo_015.explanation: The Caspian Sea, with a surface area of about 371,000 km², is the world's largest enclosed inland body of water.

q_geo_016.question: Which is the largest island in the world?
q_geo_016.hint: This island is an autonomous territory of Denmark.
q_geo_016.explanation: Greenland, with an area of about 2.166 million km², is the world's largest island. Australia is larger but is classified as a continent.

q_geo_017.question: What is the deepest lake in the world?
q_geo_017.hint: This lake is located in Siberia, Russia.
q_geo_017.explanation: Lake Baikal in Russia reaches a depth of 1,642 meters, making it the deepest and oldest freshwater lake in the world.

q_geo_018.question: What is the smallest ocean in the world?
q_geo_018.hint: This ocean surrounds the North Pole and is mostly covered by sea ice.
q_geo_018.explanation: The Arctic Ocean covers about 14.06 million km², making it the smallest and shallowest of the five oceans.

q_geo_019.question: Which African country has the largest land area?
q_geo_019.hint: This North African country borders the Mediterranean Sea and the Sahara Desert covers most of its territory.
q_geo_019.explanation: Algeria is the largest country in Africa with an area of about 2.38 million km², surpassing the DR Congo after South Sudan's independence in 2011.

q_geo_020.question: Which river is the longest in Europe?
q_geo_020.hint: This river flows entirely within Russia and empties into the Caspian Sea.
q_geo_020.explanation: The Volga River is approximately 3,530 km long, making it the longest river in Europe. It flows through central Russia to the Caspian Sea.

q_geo_021.question: Which country has the most islands in the world?
q_geo_021.hint: This Scandinavian country has over 267,000 islands, mostly small and uninhabited.
q_geo_021.explanation: Sweden has approximately 267,570 islands, more than any other country, though most are tiny and uninhabited.

q_geo_022.question: What is the capital of Brazil?
q_geo_022.hint: This purpose-built city was designed by architect Oscar Niemeyer and urban planner Lúcio Costa.
q_geo_022.explanation: Brasília became Brazil's capital in 1960, replacing Rio de Janeiro. It was planned and built from scratch in just 41 months.

q_geo_023.question: What is the tallest waterfall in the world?
q_geo_023.hint: Located in Venezuela, water drops from a flat-topped mountain called a 'tepui' — so high that much of it turns to mist before reaching the ground.
q_geo_023.explanation: Angel Falls in Venezuela drops 979 meters, making it the world's tallest uninterrupted waterfall. It was named after Jimmy Angel, a US aviator who flew over it in 1933.

q_geo_024.question: Which country is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun'?
q_geo_024.hint: This island nation's flag features a red circle on a white background, symbolizing the sun.
q_geo_024.explanation: Japan is called the 'Land of the Rising Sun' because it lies east of the Asian mainland. The Japanese name 'Nihon' literally means 'origin of the sun.'

q_geo_025.question: What is the largest country in the world by area?
q_geo_025.hint: Spanning 11 time zones from Eastern Europe to the Pacific, this country covers more than one-eighth of Earth's inhabited land.
q_geo_025.explanation: Russia covers approximately 17.1 million km², making it the largest country by area — nearly twice the size of Canada, the second largest.

q_geo_026.question: Which river flows through the Grand Canyon?
q_geo_026.hint: Its name means 'colored red' in Spanish, reflecting its muddy waters — and it carved one of the world's most famous canyons over millions of years.
q_geo_026.explanation: The Colorado River carved the Grand Canyon over approximately 5–6 million years. The canyon stretches 446 km long and up to 1,800 meters deep.
